answers.answer: Have a full thyroid panel run: TSH, free t4. free t3, thyroid antibodies. Start there. It could be a symptom, but also something else. If the TSH is closer to the upper end of the range, or over it, it could be thyroid related. Esp. if antibodies are positive.Good luck and post back when you get the results.

THe very first sign of my thyroid problem (as we now know in retrospect) was my periods doing the same. Since we had no prior baseline data on my thyroid we thought it was fine. It continued to get worse until it was diagnosed several years later. Had they checked my antibodies at thetime it would have been diagnosed right away! Find a specialist who knows. that may not necessarily be an endo as they are normally only trained in diabetes.
